question: The southern Deccan area is in a rain shadow and receives only
option1: 50 to 1000 mm of rainfall a year
option2: 100 to 200 mm of rainfall a year
option3: 200 to 400 mm of rainfall a year
option4: 50 to 400 mm of rainfall a year
answer: 50 to 1000 mm of rainfall a year
explanation: The southern Deccan area is in a "rain shadow" and receives only fifty to 1,000 millimeters of rainfall a year. Temperature ranges are wide--from some 15°C to 38°C--making this one of India's most comfortable climatic areas.
